Field Detail

MAX_CONVERTED_STRING_LENGTH

public static final int MAX_CONVERTED_STRING_LENGTH
The maximum number of characters read from an 8-bit array field being converted into a Java String.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

base_offset

protected int base_offset
The base offset into the data. This allows the message data to exist at some non-zero offset into the actual data.

data_length

protected int data_length
The actual length of the message data. Must be less than or equal to (data.length - base_offset).

am_type

protected int am_type
The AM type corresponding to this object. Set to -1 if no AM type is known.

Constructor Detail

Message

protected Message(int data_length)
Construct a new message of the given size.

Parameters:
data_length - The size of the message to create.

Message

protected Message(int data_length,
                  int base_offset)
Construct a new message of the given size and base offset. Allocates a new byte array of size data_length+base_offset.

Parameters:
data_length - The size of the message to create.
base_offset - The base offset into the newly created message.

Message

protected Message(byte[] data)
Construct a message using data as the storage. The length of data determines the length of this message.

Parameters:
data - the storage for this message

Message

protected Message(byte[] data,
                  int base_offset)
Construct a message using data as the storage. Use the given base_offset as the base offset into the data array. The data length will be (data.length - base_offset).

Parameters:
data - the storage for this message
base_offset - the base offset into the data array

Message

protected Message(byte[] data,
                  int base_offset,
                  int data_length)
Construct a message using data as the storage. Use the given base_offset as the base offset into the data array, and the specified data length.

Parameters:
data - the storage for this message
base_offset - the base offset into the data array
data_length - the length of the message data

Message

protected Message(Message msg,
                  int base_offset,
                  int data_length)
Construct an embedded message within the given 'msg'. Use the given base_offset as the base offset into the data array, and the specified data length.

Parameters:
msg - the message to embed this message into
base_offset - the base offset into the data array
data_length - the length of the message data

clone

Clone this Message, including making a copy of its data

Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object

clone

public Message clone(int size)
Clone this Message, but give it a new unitialised data array of size size

Parameters:
size - size of the new data array

dataSet

public void dataSet(byte[] data)
Copy new data for this message from 'data'. Copies min(data.length, this.data_length) bytes.

Parameters:
data - the array containing the data to be copied
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if any of data[0..getData().length - 1] are invalid

dataSet

public void dataSet(byte[] data,
                    int offsetFrom,
                    int offsetTo,
                    int length)
Copy new data for this message from offsetFrom in data to offsetTo in this message. Copies a total of length bytes

Parameters:
data - the array containing the data to be copied
offsetFrom - the offset in data to start copying from
offsetTo - the offset at which to start copying data into this message.
length - bytes are copied.
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if any of the source or target indices are invalid

dataSet

public void dataSet(Message msg,
                    int offsetTo)
Copy new data for this message from the raw data in msg to offsetTo in this message. Copies a total of msg.dataLength() bytes

Parameters:
msg - the message containing the data to be copied
offsetTo - the offset at which to start copying data into this message.
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if any of the target indices are invalid

dataGet

public byte[] dataGet()
Return the raw byte array representing the data of this message. Note that only indices in the range (this.baseOffset(), this.baseOffset()+this.dataLength()) are valid.

baseOffset

public int baseOffset()
Return the base offset into the data array for this message.

dataLength

public int dataLength()
Return the length of the data (in bytes) contained in this message.

amType

public int amType()
Return the active message type of this message (-1 if unknown)

                              int length)
Read the length bit unsigned little-endian int at offset

Parameters:

length - bit length of the unsigned int
Throws:

setUIntElement

protected void setUIntElement(int offset,
                              int length,
                              long val)
Set the length bit unsigned little-endian int at offset to val

Parameters:
offset - bit offset where the unsigned int starts
length - bit length of the unsigned int
val - value to set the bit field to
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - for invalid offset, length
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if val is an out-of-range value for this bitfield

getUIntBEElement

protected long getUIntBEElement(int offset,
                                int length)
Read the length bit unsigned big-endian int at offset

Parameters:
offset - bit offset where the unsigned int starts. Note that these are big-endian bit offsets: bit 0 is the MSB, bit 7 the LSB.
length - bit length of the unsigned int
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - for invalid offset, length

length - bit length of the unsigned int
val - value to set the bit field to
